page.title: 05CRANLEIGH SCHOOL
page.content: Cranleigh School, now one of the most famous public schools was opened in 1865, within two months of the arrival of the railway. It was intended for the sons of farmers and there were 22 boarders and 4 day boys. The fees were Â£30 per annum. There are now around 800 boys and a few girls in the Sixth form. They are still mainly boarders but some local boys attend as day boys. In 1912 ground adjacent was pur_ chased and a Preparatory School built, it takes boys from the age of 8 years. Through many generous donations from old boys the buildings were expanded to provide science laboratories, a library, gymnasium, speech hall and modern dormitories and studies. Standing on a rise at the edge of the village it has a golf course as part of its extensive sports grounds.
